results.name: default/wordpress-deployment-7f46c78d86-kkr7q
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql-deployment-78bcc59c48-nb667
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/mysql-service

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-deployment-78bcc59c48-nb667], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs Pod/mysql-deployment-78bcc59c48-nb667`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure the pod is running and healthy.

results.name: default/wordpress-service

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-deployment-7f46c78d86-kkr7q], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-deployment-7f46c78d86-kkr7q`.
3. Resolve any issues found (e.g., image pull errors, insufficient resources).
4. Ensure the pod becomes ready.
